title: Fix dashboard desktop breakpoint behavior and refresh DailyQuote at calendar day rollover

requirements.summary: Ensure the Dashboard uses its existing `lg:*` multi-column grid layouts on desktop widths without changing visual design or component composition.
acceptanceCriteria: On a desktop viewport width ≥ 1024px, the dashboard uses the multi-column grid layouts defined with `lg:*` classes (e.g., clocks display in two columns; the quote/stats section uses three columns).
On mobile widths, the layout remains single-column as it is today.
No redesign: no intentional changes to typography, spacing scale, colors, card styles, or component composition beyond what is required to make the desktop breakpoint apply.

file_operations.description: Explicitly define Tailwind responsive `screens` (including `lg: 1024px`) so `lg:*` variants reliably compile/apply at desktop widths; keep existing theme extensions and visual tokens unchanged.

Make minimal, non-visual wiring adjustments needed to ensure the existing `lg:grid-cols-2` and `lg:grid-cols-3` classes take effect on large screens (no changes to layout structure/content beyond what’s required to restore the intended desktop breakpoint behavior).

requirements.summary: Auto-refresh the cached DailyQuote when the local calendar day changes (including while the tab remains open), preserving existing localStorage keys and UI markup.
acceptanceCriteria: If the app remains open across midnight, the DailyQuote section refreshes to a new daily quote without requiring a manual page reload.
The localStorage keys currently used (`cachedQuote` and `quoteCacheDate` in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts`) remain in use, and a quote is still reused within the same calendar day.
DailyQuote’s visual output/structure remains unchanged (no changes to layout/markup besides any minimal wiring needed to trigger refresh).

file_operations.description: Add a day-rollover mechanism (e.g., a computed 'today' value that updates at the next local midnight and/or on focus) and incorporate it into the React Query behavior (e.g., queryKey invalidation or keying by day) so `useQuote()` refetches on calendar day change while continuing to use `cachedQuote` and `quoteCacheDate` for same-day reuse.
